prototypes.prototype: Table_List as C = :A5.TABLE_ENUM( [ options as N ] )
Next_Table_Name as C = :A5.TABLE_ENUM( lastname as C )

argument.name: Table_List
argument.description: A list of tables in various formats, depending on the Flag variable.

argument.name: Next_Table_Name
argument.description: The next table the list of tables. A NULL value "" returns the first table in the list.

argument.name: lastname
argument.description: The quoted name of a table.

page.description: Returns the name of the next Table in the current database.
page.discussion: The A5.TABLE_ENUM() method returns a CR-LF delimited list of all tables listed in the Control Panel. In contrast, the A5_TABLE_ENUM_ACTUAL() function checks to see that the table exists, or it is not included in the list Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.description: Refer also to A5 Enumeration Methods. This script updates the indexes for all of the tables in a database.
section.example: dim tbl as P table_name = :a5.table_enum("") if (table_name <> "") then 'While the table_enum method returns nonblank names, get next name while (table_name <> "") :Statusbar.Set_Text("Updating indexes for: " + table_name) tbl = table.open(table_name) tbl.update_production_index() tbl.close() table_name = :A5.table_enum(table_name) end while end if :Statusbar.Set_Text("Done!!")
